metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12886 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low
metadata.Description:
stack_protect_prologue in cfgexpand.c and stack_protect_epilogue infunction.c in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) 4.1 through 8 (under certaincircumstances) generate instruction sequences when targeting ARM targetsthat spill the address of the stack protector guard, which allows anattacker to bypass the protection of -fstack-protector,-fstack-protector-all, -fstack-protector-strong, and-fstack-protector-explicit against stack overflow by controlling what thestack canary is compared against.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12886` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cpp-9 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
g++-9 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
g++-9-multilib - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gcc-9 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gcc-9-base - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gcc-9-hppa64-linux-gnu - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gcc-9-locales - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gcc-9-multilib - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gcc-9-offload-nvptx - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gcc-9-source - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gcc-9-test-results - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2

gdc-9-multilib - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2

gobjc++-9-multilib - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2

gobjc-9-multilib - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
lib32asan5 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
lib32go14 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
lib32gphobos76 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
lib64asan5 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
lib64go14 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
lib64gphobos76 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
libasan5 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
libgm2-0 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
libgnat-9 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
libgnatvsn9 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2

libx32gphobos76 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gcc-snapshot package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-9 package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.3.0-10ubuntu2').
gcc-arm-none-eabi package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
